meanings.definition: A loud electric horn or alarm typically used on motor vehicles.
meanings.sent1: The klaxon blared loudly, alerting everyone to the danger.
meanings.sent2: The klaxon on the ambulance wailed as it rushed through traffic.
meanings.sent3: The klaxon startled the sleepy town, causing chaos in the streets.
meanings.sent4: The klaxon's piercing sound cut through the silence of the night.
meanings.sent5: The klaxon's blaring noise was impossible to ignore.

meanings.definition: To sound a klaxon as a warning signal.
meanings.sent1: He had to klaxon repeatedly to get the attention of the distracted pedestrians.
meanings.sent2: The ship captain decided to klaxon to alert nearby boats of the storm.
meanings.sent3: She would klaxon playfully whenever her friends tried to sneak up on her.
meanings.sent4: The teacher had to klaxon to quiet down the rowdy classroom.
meanings.sent5: The klaxoning echoed through the valley, warning of the impending danger.
